channel.title: c3 on dfangx's website
channel.description: Recent content in c3 on dfangx's website

item.title: Day 115, 1 Chronicles 3-5
item.description: Chapter 3 through 5 follow the genealogies of the tribes of Judah, Simeon, Reuban, Gad, and Manasseh. Chapter 3 also recounts the genealogy of David.

item.title: Day 111, 2 Samuel 1-4
item.description: The news of Saul’s death reached David by an Amalekite. The Amalekite lied about how Saul died, potentially trying to earn favour with David.

item.title: Day 98, 1 Samuel 1-3
item.description: The birth of Samuel gives a glimpse into the hearts of the people of Israel and the priesthood of God. Hannah was barren, yet persistently prayed to God for a child.

item.title: Day 90, Joshua 3-5
item.description: God left several nations behind to test Israel, to see if they would keep his commandments. Unfortunately, as God said would happen, the people of Israel and the other nations intermixed, and the Canaanites became a snare for Israel.

item.title: Day 82, Joshua 1-4
item.description: Joshua officially takes over leadership of Israel. God reiterates what he said before to Joshua, but this time in his new capacity as leader.

item.title: Day 71
item.description: God gave King Og of Bashan over to the Israelites. Thus, Israel took control of the territory of two of the Amorite kings.

item.title: Titus 3
item.description: The people in Crete are reminded in how they are supposed to live towards authorities, other believers, and towards the general population.

item.title: Day 55, Numbers 3-4
item.description: A count of the sons of Aaron and the Levites is performed. At the same time, the duties of the Levites are given.

item.title: Day 44, Leviticus 1-4
item.description: The laws concerning burnt offerings, peace offerings, and sin offerings all use some sort of animal as the offering. All sacrifices and offerings take place just outside the tent of meeting.

item.title: Day 30, Exodus 1-3
item.description: The children of Israel increased in number and strength. In time, the Egyptians began to fear the Israelites and oppressed them, making them slaves.

item.title: Galatians 3
item.description: For the Galatians in the church, they were there as witnesses to the public crucifixion of Christ. Yet, the Spirit was given to them because of faith.

item.title: Day 4, Job 1-5
item.description: Job was one of the greatest men in the east. He was blameless and righteous before before God and feared God.

item.title: Day 1, Genesis 1-3
item.description: The world before creation is described as formless, empty, and dark. Yet, the presence of God is there, it is clear that wherever God is, something is bound to happen.
